Class Member

java.lang.Object
domain.Person
domain.Member
public class Member extends Person
Represents a library member who can borrow books and manage fines.

The Member class extends Person and adds functionality specific to library members, including fine management and borrowing eligibility.

  • Constructor Details

    • Member

      public Member(String userName, String password)
      Constructs a new Member with the specified username and password. The fine balance is initialized to zero.
      Parameters:
      userName - the username used for authentication
      password - the password used for authentication

    • Member

      public Member()
      Default Constructor.

    • Member

      public Member(String userName, String password, String name, String id, String phone)
      Constructs a new Member with detailed profile information. The fine balance is initialized to zero.
      Parameters:
      userName - the username used for authentication
      password - the password used for authentication
      name - the member's full name
      id - the unique ID of the member
      phone - the member's phone number

    • Member

      public Member(String id, String email, String password)
      Constructs a new Member using an ID as the name and an email for login. The fine balance is initialized to zero.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the member (also set as the display name)
      email - the email used for authentication
      password - the password used for authentication

  • Method Details

    • getFineBalance

      public double getFineBalance()
      Returns the current fine balance of the member.
      Returns:
      the fine balance

    • setFineBalance

      public void setFineBalance(double fineBalance)
      Sets the fine balance for the member.
      Parameters:
      fineBalance - the new fine balance to set

    • addMemberFine

      public void addMemberFine(double amount)
      Adds a fine amount to the member's account.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to add to the fine balance

    • payMemberFine

      public void payMemberFine(double amount)
      Pays part or all of the member's outstanding fines.

      If the payment amount exceeds the current fine balance, only the remaining balance is cleared and any extra amount is ignored.

      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to pay toward the fine (must be positive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is non-positive

    • canBorrow

      public boolean canBorrow()
      Determines whether the member is eligible to borrow books.

      A member can only borrow books if their fine balance is zero.

      Returns:
      true if the member can borrow books, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the member with their details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the member

    • calculateTotalFines

      public double calculateTotalFines(Iterable<Loan> loans, LocalDate today)
      Calculates the total fines across the provided loans for this member as of the given date. Only considers this member's non-returned loans; each loan's fine is recalculated based on today.
      Parameters:
      loans - an iterable collection of loans to inspect (may be null)
      today - the date used to calculate fines
      Returns:
      the sum of fine amounts for this member's active loans
